metadata.title: CVE-2017-2668 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS (noble) - medium
metadata.description:
389-ds-base before versions 1.3.5.17 and 1.3.6.10 is vulnerable to aninvalid pointer dereference in the way LDAP bind requests are handled. Aremote unauthenticated attacker could use this flaw to make ns-slapd crashvia a specially crafted LDAP bind request, resulting in denial of service.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-2668` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

389-ds - 1.3.7.10-1ubuntu1
389-ds-base - 1.3.7.10-1ubuntu1
389-ds-base-libs - 1.3.7.10-1ubuntu1
cockpit-389-ds - 1.3.7.10-1ubuntu1
python3-lib389 - 1.3.7.10-1ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: 389-ds-base package in noble, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.3.7.10-1ubuntu1').
